Key Match Events: Indonesia almost won at Bahrain headquarters. Having been 2-1 ahead until eight minutes of injury time, the Indonesian national team’s victory was shattered after Bahrain scored an equalizer through Mohamed Marhoon in the ninth minute.

Referee Ahmed Al Kaf’s controversial decision at the end of the match ruined the Indonesian national team‘s victory. The referee from Oman gave six minutes of extra time in the second half, but instead, the match was allowed to end for nine minutes. Bahrain was able to equalize in the 90+9th minute.
Post-Match Reflections: Indonesian national team coach Shin Tae-yong expressed disappointment about referee Ahmed Al Kaf’s leadership during the match against Bahrain in the 2026 World Cup Qualification for the Asian Zone.
Shin Tae-yong also called the referee’s decision in this match biased, which caused the Indonesian national team players to express anger at the end of the match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match went viral on social media because it was full of controversy.

The Indonesian national team received an additional 4.39 points in the FIFA ranking, but the Indonesian national team’s position in the FIFA ranking has not changed, remaining in 129th position in the world.
Dragan Talajic’s team dropped to 78th in the FIFA world ranking after losing 4.39 points.
Others: The match was played at Bahrain National Stadium, Riffa, Thursday (10/10/2024).
Bahrain’s goals came through Mohamed Marhoon in the 15th minute and 90+8′. Meanwhile, the Indonesian national team scored through Ragnar Oratmangoen in the 45+2nd minute and Rafael Struick 74′.
